title: 107_hr4155
content: The Act titled "District of Columbia Legislative Autonomy Act of 2002" eliminates congressional review of newly-passed District laws. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to remove congressional review of newly-passed District laws. Section 602 and section 604 are struck, and the exercise of rulemaking power by Congress is specified. The rules of the House of Representatives and the Senate shall be considered as part of each House and may be changed at any time. SEC. 3. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is being amended to make changes to various sections, including removing certain sentences and redesignating subsections. Additionally, payments by the District for principal, interest, or other expenses will not be subject to appropriation. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is being amended to exclude payments for revenue anticipation notes from the appropriation requirement. Other sections are also being revised, including those related to initiative and referendum procedures. Amendments are made to various sections of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act, including changes to initiative and referendum procedures. Amendments are made to the District of Columbia Home Rule Act, including changes to initiative and referendum procedures by striking certain sections and sentences in subsection (m). The amendments made by this Act to the District of Columbia Home Rule Act, including changes to initiative and referendum procedures, shall apply to acts passed by the Council of the District of Columbia on or after October 1, 2002.
